item.title: About me
item.description: I am a Ph.D. Candidate in Economics, Washington University in St. Louis. My primary fields of interest are behavioral and experimental economics, along with the secondary interests in microeconomic theory and economics of networks. I come from a multicultural background as a descendant of a Chinese immigrant family in South Korea. Born and raised in a rural town of Korea, my journey began when I first arrived in Kansas as an exchange student in my high school days.

Job Market Paper “Lying Aversion and Vague Communication: An Experimental Study” with Guangying Chen [abstract] We study the effect of allowing vague communication on one’s lying behavior using a model of costly lying and provide empirical knowledge through an online experiment.
